&app; is the application for managing your primary encryption key and how the passphrase for your key is stored after performing an encryption operation.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: You can use &app; to select your primary encryption key and how the passphrase for your key is stored after performing an encryption operation.

Additionally, this manual contains information pertaining to encryption plugins provided for:
Gedit Text Editor
Nautilus File Manager
Epiphany Web Browser

sect1.title: File Manager Integration
sect1.para: &app; integrates with Nautilus. You can encrypt, decrypt, sign and verify files as well as import public keys from the file manager window without launching &app;.

sect2.title: Encrypting Files
sect2.para:
To encrypt files from the file manager, perform the following steps:
Select one or more files from the file manager,
Right click on any selected file and choose Encrypt,
Select the people you would like to encypt the file to, and then click OK.

sect2.title: Signing Files
sect2.para:
To sign files from the file manager, perform the following steps:
Select one or more files from the file manager,
Right click on any selected file and choose Sign,
If asked, enter the passphrase of your private key.

sect2.title: Decrypting Files
sect2.para:
To decrypt an encrypted file from the file manager, perform the following steps:
Double click on the file you want to decrypt,
If asked, enter the passphrase of your private key.

sect2.title: Verifing Signatures
sect2.para: To verify files, simply double click on the the detached signature file.

note.para: Detached signature file names often take the form <file name>.sig

sect1.title: Text Editor Integration
sect1.para:
To enable the Text Encryption plugin in Gedit, the GNOME text editor, perform the following steps:
Run Gedit by choosing
Applications Accessories Text Editor ,
Choose
Edit Preferences ,
In the Plugin tab, select the Text Encryption plugin.

sect2.title: Encrypting Text
sect2.para:
To encrypt a selection of text from Gedit, perform the following steps:
Select the text you want to encrypt, and choose
Edit Encrypt ,
Select the people you want to encrypt the text to, and click OK.
You can now copy or save the encrypted text.

sect2.title: Signing Text
sect2.para:
To sign a selection of text from Gedit, perform the following steps:
Select the text you want to sign and choose
Edit Sign ,
Insert, if asked, the passphrase of your private key.
You can now copy or save the signed text.

sect2.title: Decrypting/Verifing Text
sect2.para:
To decrypt and/or verify a selection of text from Gedit, perform the following steps:
Select the text you want to decrypt/verify and choose
Edit Decrypt/Verify ,
Insert, if asked, the passphrase of your private key.
You can now copy or save the decrypted text.

sect1.title: Web Browser Integration
sect1.para: This extension allows encryption, decryption, signing and importing of the contents of text fields.

To enable the encryption extension in Epiphany Web Browser, the GNOME web browser, perform the following steps:
Run Epiphany Web Browser by choosing
Applications Internet Epiphany Web Browser ,
Choose
Tools Extensions ,
Select the Seahorse plugin.

sect2.title: Encrypting Text
sect2.para:
To encrypt the contents of a text input field in Epiphany Web Browser, perform the following steps:
Right click in the text input field you want to encrypt, and choose
Encrypt ,
Select the people you want to encrypt the text to, and click OK.
The encrypted text will now appear in the text input field.

sect2.title: Signing Text
sect2.para:
To sign the contents of a text input field in Epiphany Web Browser, perform the following steps:
Right click in the text input field you want to sign and choose
Sign ,
Insert, if asked, the passphrase of your private key.
The signed text will now appear in the text input field.

sect2.title: Decrypting/Verifing Text
sect2.para:
To decrypt and/or verify the contents of a text input field in Epiphany Web Browser, perform the following steps:
Right click in the text input field you want to decrypt/verify and choose
Decrypt/Verify ,
Insert, if asked, the passphrase of your private key.
The decrypted text will now appear in the text input field.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: This section describes the preferences settable in &app;.

sect2.title: Encryption Preferences
sect2.para:
This section describes the preferences settable by choosing
System Preferences Encryption and Keyrings from the panel.

listitem.para: This is the key that will be used by applications and plugins to sign files. It will also be the key that files will be encrypted to if encrypt to self is selected.

term.guilabel: When encrypting, always include myself as a recipient

listitem.para: Sets the encrypt to self option, whether or not you will be added to the recipients list for all files that are encrypted.

note.para: If you do not select this and you do not select yourself as a recipient you will not be unable to decrypt any files you encrypt.

sect3.title: Passphrase Cache
sect3.para: Enabling the passphrase caching ability will allow you to perform many operations that require entering your passphrase without re-entering it every time. seahorse-agent takes the place of gpg-agent. Letting the cached passphrases expire is usually a good idea. This will then require re-entering your passphrase, but adds security.

listitem.para: Sets to not remember any passphrase.
Sets the amount of time, in minutes, for storing passphrases. Use the spin box to set the desired time.

term.guilabel: Always remember passphrases whenever logged in

listitem.para: Sets to remember any passphrases whenever you are logged in the session.

term.guilabel: Ask me before using a cached passphrase

listitem.para: Sets to ask you before using a stored passphrase.
Sets to automatically cache any Secure Shell key.

sect1.title: About &app;
sect1.para: Passwords and Encryption Keys, its associated plugins, the preferences applet and the panel applet are known collectively as the &project;. The original author of the &project; is Jacob Perkins. The current maintainers are Stef Walter and Adam Schreiber. This manual is by Adam Schreiber. The project's web site was designed by Jim Pharis. To find more information about &project;, the project , please visit the &project; web page.
